alert.note: Alert for Northern Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:28AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Fairfield, northern Westchester and eastern Putnam Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1227 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Fairfield to near Mount Kisco. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danbury, Sherman, Brewster, Newtown, Ridgefield, Bethel, Wilton, Brookfield, New Fairfield, Weston, Redding, Carmel, Yorktown Heights, Georgetown and Patterson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
